1-d-10-30-87-CHR.Narrative: THE FOLLOWING IS A REPORT OF THE CHESTNUT RIDGE RAILWAY COMPANY OF A RAILCAR DERAILMENT ON FRIDAY, OCTOBER 30, 1987. THE DERAILMENT INVOLVED TWO 80-TON ANHYDROUS AMMONIA TANK CARS, ONE BOX CAR, AND TWO CONRAILOPEN GONDOLA CARS. ALL FIVE CARS WERE DERAILED FROM THE TRACKS AND WERE A PART OF A 23-CARTRAIN WHICH WAS BEING PULLED BY THE CHESTNUT RIDGE RAILWAY. AT APPROXIMATELY 2:00 P.M. FRIDAY, THE CHESTNUT RIDGE RAILWAY CREW-ENGINEER, CONDUCTOR AND BRAKEMEN-WAS IN THE PROCESS OF MOVING THE 23 RAILCARS FROM THE EAST PLANT YARD TO THE CONRAIL YARD FOR PICK-UP BY CONRAIL, VIA LOCOMOTIVE NO. 21.THECARS HAD BEEN WEIGHED ANDPLACED ON THE MAIN LINE. THE ENGINE WAS TRAVELING WEST THROUGH THE MAIN LINE SWITCH WHEN THE FOURTEENTH CAR, SFTX 961, ENTERED THE SWITCH AND APPARENTLY "PICKED THE SWITCH", CAUSING THE "A" END OF THE CAR TO JUMP OVER THE ADJOINING TRACKS, AND THE NEXT FOUR CARS TO DERAIL. (SEE ORIGINAL NARRATIVE)NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
